definition: surname Di/generic name for northern ethnic minorities during the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 BC-220 AD)
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: The Dirac equation is decomposed into a pair of equations of two spinors.
sentences.chinese: 把狄拉克方程分解成了两个单旋量的联立方程组。

sentences.english: I consider it a great honor to introduce to you rather briefly Professor Dirac.
sentences.chinese: 我很荣幸能向大家简要地介绍一下狄拉克教授。

sentences.english: In chapter 1 we introduce the Driac equation following the physically motivated approach of Dirac.
sentences.chinese: 第一章我们介绍基于狄拉克之自然逼近的狄拉克方程。

sentences.english: In chapter 1 we introduce the Driac equation following the physically motivated approach of Dirac.
sentences.chinese: 第一章我们介绍基于狄拉克之自然逼近的狄拉克方程。

definition: Henri Poincaré (1854-1912), French mathematician, physician and philosopher
Fermi (name)/Enrico Fermi (1901-1954), Italian born US nuclear physicist

pinyin: liang4 zi3 dian4 dong4 li4 xue2

definition: Ludwig Boltzmann (1844-1906), Austrian physicist and philosopher
Werner Heisenberg (1901-1976), German physicist/also written 海森伯
Higgs (name)/Peter Higgs (1929-), British theoretical physicist, one proposer of the Higgs mechanism or Higgs boson to explain the mass of elementary particles
